> 
> 
> On 6/17/2018 at 7:17 AM, Tonas1997 said:
> 
> 
> Anyone knows if there's a fix for the Tweakscale/RealFuels compatibility problems for 1.3.1?
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Resizing an engine will, sometimes, change its mass to a negative number, causing the craft to either float on the launchpad or be broken apart. Apparently, it's a well known bug ([and there are a few issues on GitHub that mention it](https://github.com/NathanKell/ModularFuelSystem/issues/165)), but I haven't found any patches that fix it...
> 

Have you checked the .cfg file for bugs?

Pure guess, I use ksp v 1.4.3

Nice mod by the way. Finally be able to do something real kerbal style.

Will you make the mod able to rescale parts to larger sizes or rescale multiple parts at once?

>

> 
> 
> Nice mod by the way. Finally be able to do something real kerbal style.
>

> 
> 
> Will you make the mod able to rescale parts to larger sizes or rescale multiple parts at once?
> 

I already fixed the problem (and by "I" I mean a forum user on the RealFuels thread) by disabling mass scaling on RF's side.

Could you make an update so it works with MH?

(I just like the engines but want to use them in a smaller size)

**Edited <time datetime="2018-07-25T16:53:15Z" title="07/25/2018 04:53  PM" data-short="5 yr">July 25, 2018</time> by TeslaPenguin1**
Hi I'm trying to use this mod with Nebula Decals.  I'd like to rescale the decals without increasing the mass.  I'd like to keep the other parts re-scaling behavior unaffected.  Any ideas?

[@pellinor](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/85299-pellinor/)

I noticed that all the included scale types which have scaleFactors corresponding to stock sizes don't have the 1.875 size.  Are you planning on adding that anytime soon?

> 
> 
> On 7/29/2018 at 4:39 PM, linuxgurugamer said:
> 
> 
> [@pellinor](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/85299-pellinor/)
> 
> 
> 
> 
> I noticed that all the included scale types which have scaleFactors corresponding to stock sizes don't have the 1.875 size.  Are you planning on adding that anytime soon?
> 

Yes, I guess that makes sense now that 1.875 has become a stock size.

> 
> 
> On 7/26/2018 at 4:53 AM, captainb said:
> 
> 
> Hi I'm trying to use this mod with Nebula Decals.  I'd like to rescale the decals without increasing the mass.  I'd like to keep the other parts re-scaling behavior unaffected.  Any ideas?
> 

    @PART[...]
    {
        %MODULE[TweakScale]
        {
            type = ...
            defaultScale = ...
            TWEAKSCALEEXPONENTS { mass = 0 }
        }
    }

A patch like this should do the trick. Of course it also means that the mass does not decrease for a smaller part.

>

> 

The mass is 0.001 already

Hey,

i have little problem with a resized Drill-o-Matic and Convert-o-Tron. It seems they don't cool down even with a bunch of radiators.

Is there a workaround for this?
Rescaleable docking parts would be very nice.

> 
> 
> 7 hours ago, raxo2222 said:
> 
> 
> Rescaleable docking parts would be very nice.
> 

This would be tough because there's code in the config that tells the game what size the docking port is. If you just resized a 1.25m to another size the game would still think it's supposed to attach to a 1.25m port

> 
> 
> 10 minutes ago, Tyko said:
> 
> 
> This would be tough because there's code in the config that tells the game what size the docking port is. If you just resized a 1.25m to another size the game would still think it's supposed to attach to a 1.25m port
> 

What are mods with bigger docking parts?

> 
> 
> Just now, raxo2222 said:
> 
> 
> What are mods with bigger docking parts?
> 

<iframe allowfullscreen="" data-controller="core.front.core.autosizeiframe" data-embedcontent="" data-embedid="embed994282281" scrolling="no" src="https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/90545-14-spacey-heavy-lifter-parts-pack-v1171-2018-04-02/&do=embed" style="height:228px;max-width:502px;"></iframe>

[@Lisias](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/187168-lisias/) what is this?

1.  
[https://github.com/net-lisias-kspu/TweakScale/releases/tag/RELEASE%2F2.3.12.1](https://github.com/net-lisias-kspu/TweakScale/releases/tag/RELEASE%2F2.3.12.1)  

in there it says

> 
> 
> Quote
> 
> 
> - Added hard dependency for [KSP API Extensions/L](https://github.com/net-lisias-ksp/KSPAPIExtensions).
> 

2.  

So, [KSP API Extensions/L](https://github.com/net-lisias-ksp/KSPAPIExtensions).  

The master repo only includes MiniAVC inside the GameData folder, there is no release available ...

So what is this? Unfinished project?

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, Gordon Dry said:
> 
> 
> [@Lisias](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/187168-lisias/) what is this?
> 

It's pretty clear it's a fork from a project, IMHO. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)") (couldn't help myself. hehehe)

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, Gordon Dry said:
> 
> 
> So, [KSP API Extensions/L](https://github.com/net-lisias-ksp/KSPAPIExtensions).  
> 
> The master repo only includes MiniAVC inside the GameData folder, there is no release available ...
> 
> 
> 
> 
> So what is this? Unfinished project?
> 

Nops. A Working in Progress project. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)") 

Feel free to clone, build and install it manually if you want (you will need to configure a CONFIG.INC file on the parent's directory to set the bash environment variables if you want to use my scripts) -  but keep in mind that it is still Alpha : lots of things can change or break at any time. I just double-checked my local copy, and everything is sync'ed to the github's repo, so you should be fine if you try it.

Keep in mind, also, that the following rules apply on every "kspu" project of mine:  
  
[http://ksp.lisias.net/add-ons/Unofficial-Initiative](http://ksp.lisias.net/add-ons/Unofficial-Initiative)

> 
> 
> On 9/24/2018 at 11:12 AM, Gordon Dry said:
> 
> 
> So, [KSP API Extensions/L](https://github.com/net-lisias-ksp/KSPAPIExtensions).
> 

There's a proper (new) release available just now.

[https://github.com/net-lisias-ksp/KSPAPIExtensions/releases](https://github.com/net-lisias-ksp/KSPAPIExtensions/releases)

Are there any known issues between Tweakscale and <abbr title="Ferram Aerospace Research (mod)">FAR</abbr>'s adjustable wing weight/structural stength? Some mass figures don't add up at all, they appear to be multiplied by an unrelated factor. Getting different mass readouts just from directly connecting a wing to a root part, for example.

**Edited <time datetime="2018-10-07T21:42:31Z" title="10/07/2018 09:42  PM" data-short="5 yr">October 7, 2018</time> by Tricky14**

Im having an issue with the rover wheels clipping into the ground and being immobilized. [See here](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/89208-rover-wheels-clipping-and-stuck/). Only happens when i tweakscale em down..any suggestions? Im using the retractable rover wheel. It works fine at stock scale. But once its scaled down..it clips into the ground and runway. Thanks!
1.5 is flagging this mod as incompatible. I haven't checked if it still works or not.

> 
> 
> 5 hours ago, MikeO89 said:
> 
> 
> 1.5 is flagging this mod as incompatible. I haven't checked if it still works or not.
> 

[@pellinor](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/85299-pellinor/) It probably only need a recompile

I have to admit I missed the release, just downloading the game now...

Considering the scaletypes, I'm not really sold on adding many intermediate values. 1.875 is a stock scale now, so that one will probably get used a lot. Tbh, I never used any exact intermediate scale other than 1.875m myself.

For more exotic scales, everyone knows there is a slider for intermediate values right? So basically we are arguing about the ergonomics of some use cases avoiding the slider versus others having to click the arrows an additional one or two times.

**Announcement:** It is no secret that my more active days in this community are long past, and I am not giving this project the attention it deserves. [@Lisias](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/187168-lisias/) has agreed to take over the development of TweakScale from now on, and I hereby pass the torch to him. Once he has opened his own release thread, this one can be closed.
